summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Daniel J. Kaiser and Assistant U.S. Attorney Kimberly Lerner regarding scheduling a call about the Epstein case in the Southern District of New York. The emails reference a previous meeting and coordination between legal teams.

persons.name: Daniel J. Kaiser
persons.context: Attorney from Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C. communicating with the prosecution about scheduling a call regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Kimberly Lerner
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York coordinating with defense counsel about the Epstein case and scheduling a call.

persons.name: William H. Kaiser
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, likely part of the legal team working on the Epstein case.

connections.description: Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating about scheduling and case coordination in the Epstein SDNY case.
Both appear to be part of the same law firm (Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C.) working on the Epstein case.

events.title: Meeting between legal teams

events.title: Scheduled call about Epstein case
events.description: Daniel J. Kaiser and Kimberly Lerner scheduled a call for Monday at 12:00 to discuss the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document shows coordination between defense attorneys and prosecutors in the Epstein case in July 2019.
Daniel J. Kaiser was in Boston for a deposition but made himself available for calls about the Epstein case.
A previous meeting between legal teams occurred on or around July 13, 2019, which was described as professional.
The emails reference multiple attorneys from both sides working on the Epstein SDNY case.
Kimberly Lerner was attending a charity function with limited service, indicating the case work occurred alongside other professional obligations.
